abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the assessment of the project
            is satisfactory, sustainability is likely, and both the Bank
            and the Borrower's performances are satisfactory. Even
            through periodic political instability, and exceptional
            challenges, the government's new administration took
            ownership of the project, and timely disbursement was
            accomplished. Key lessons suggest that the strong political
            commitment of the Ministry of Education (MOE) was paramount
            to the project success. This commitment assured MOE's
            participation and that of its various units/offices, which
            in turn achieved the necessary ownership for successful
            execution practices. However, the lack of continuity
            hindered project coordination, a factor which could have
            been minimized through the decentralization of execution
            mechanisms, and facilitate project activities. Furthermore,
            project design should allow, flexibility for possible
            modifications required during implementation, and, include a
            baseline for sustained monitoring activities, to evaluate
            interventions, redefine and/or develop strategies for
            implementation, particularly under changing political
            circumstances. Supervision should focus, specifically, in
            the execution aspects, and technical assistance, to support
            interventions, and, minimize misleading procedural aspects.
            In the absence of a Special Account, UNDP may assist as a
            purchasing agent, and establish simple
            procurement/disbursement practices.
